intro: Potentilla armeniaca, commonly known as Armenian cinquefoil, is a perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has palmate leaves divided into five to seven lobes, and its stems are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Potentilla armeniaca is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
